figgy.title: Document smtp allow list step for newly provisioned boxes
ingest PPPL technical reports into Figgy

comments.body:
I have ingested the items in <https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1lApC21IrsX3BeXyyx0nT8LcW7SQEawyCf4tCsIbQ7co/edit#gid=1262367616> as SimpleResources into <https://figgy.princeton.edu/catalog/e6080f72-4ba5-4e35-a87d-9a4eb826d0e3> using the attached JSON file, which comprises data extracted from the spreadsheet tab “new records”.

What I need from @pmgreen  is a mapping of local_identifier -> source_identifier.

When I have that, I’ll re-ingest the reports as ScannedResources with the updated metadata, and then send you a report with a mapping of source_identifier->ark, so you can update the MARC records.
[records.json.zip](https://github.com/pulibrary/figgy/files/8427665/records.json.zip)
﻿

figgy.title: Allow download of original pdf from viewer
Provide useful error message when bulk update fails

comments.body: I think this would b great. i know both would be helpful.

@hackartisan, I kept it basic and similar to that of the weekly collection report emails. Editing and suggestions most welcome. 

### Subject Line

- Bulk update status report for batch XXXX

### Bulk Update Fail

- Bulk update failed for XX Resource(s) in batch [LINK].  You received this email because you initiated a bulk update for these Resource(s). 

### Bulk Update Success

- Bulk update was successful for XX Resource(s) in batch [LINK]. You received this email because you initiated a bulk update for these Resource(s).

comments.body: @pmgreen I don't think we can really get a report like this easily. We'd need to talk to with the data warehouse maintainers. Do you think the auto-expiration workflow for these that we've added is sufficient?

Would it be reasonable to ask the circ desk managers to maintain lists of their current student employees in a shared space, like Drive, which we could audit against? Auto-expiration is better than nothing but because it's a manual process and based on fragmented communications (multiple emails and sn@p tickets), it's error prone. It would be very easy to miss someone, or to miss auto-expiring one role, etc.
This was discovered while resolving https://github.com/pulibrary/dspace-development/issues/626

The item was removed a while ago. The record had to be deleted. 
@mzelesky removed it. It will be removed from the catalog in the next incremental dump from alma.

princeton_ansible.title: adds name for pgsql backup playbook

comments.body: fully qualified role names

Building ruby from source takes longer but it lets us install specific versions (like installing specific versions of nodeJS in #2809). This offers stability and predictability and independence from third-party package management. Unless a project changes ruby versions frequently (in which case RVM or ruby-switch could be useful), this is a robust approach.
does or could this ref an issue?
oh i see the issue number in the branch name. i'll add it to the description.
Actually I don't understand how this is related to that issue.
hey @hackartisan it is wrongly referring to the issue. @bess mentioned wanting to run her apps with ruby 3 on the slack dev channel. This is the result of that.

I have tested this on staging with the current prod database. Steps to deploy:

1. "Publish" the five new pages for the DSS site that are unpublished in prod. 
2. Deploy branch with this code.
3. Activated the "pul_dss_custom_content_panes" feature.
